snippet: The treatment, known as IP, in which chemotherapy is pumped directly into the abdomen, could add 16 months or more to women’s lives, researchers say.
abstract: Study published in The Journal of Clinical Oncology confirms 2006 findings that pumping chemotherapy directly into abdomen, method known as intraperitoneal, or IP, could extend lives of women suffering from ovarian cancer; second study finds risk of death is 23 percent less in those who had IP therapy.
lead_paragraph: The treatment, known as IP, in which chemotherapy is pumped directly into the abdomen, could add 16 months or more to women’s lives, researchers say.

headline.main: Effective Ovarian Cancer Treatment Is Underused, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: An Ovarian Cancer Treatment, Recommended Since 2006, Is Found to Be Underused
